entity1.name: Butterfly
entity1.description: A flying insect known for its colorful wings and metamorphosis.
entity1.chunkid: The Life Cycle of a Butterfly1

entity2.name: Life Cycle
entity2.description: The series of changes that an organism undergoes from one stage of its life to another, including birth, growth, reproduction, and death.
entity2.chunkid: The Life Cycle of a Butterfly1

entity3.name: butterfly
entity3.description: A flying insect of the order Lepidoptera, typically distinguished from moths by their brightly colored wings and diurnal habits.
entity3.chunkid: The Life Cycle of a Butterfly2

entity4.name: egg
entity4.description: The first stage in the life cycle of a butterfly, where it begins as an egg laid by an adult female on a host plant.
entity4.chunkid: The Life Cycle of a Butterfly2

entity5.name: larva
entity5.description: The second stage in the life cycle of a butterfly, also known as a caterpillar, which hatches from an egg and feeds on plants to grow.
entity5.chunkid: The Life Cycle of a Butterfly2

entity6.name: pupa
entity6.description: The third stage in the life cycle of a butterfly, where the larva transforms into an adult inside a protective casing called a chrysalis.
entity6.chunkid: The Life Cycle of a Butterfly2

entity7.name: butterfly
entity7.description: A type of insect that undergoes a complete metamorphosis, including egg, larva, pupa, and adult stages.
